#Text=Look After Your Dog
#Text=If you have a dog or are thinking about getting one , you might want to read this article :
#Text=it gives you a step-by-step guide on how to care for your furry friend .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Preparing For a New Dog
#Text=Be prepared for the responsibility of a dog .
#Text=Think of them as your furry baby .
#Text=You 'll need to spend a lot of time with them , care for them , and buy them the things they need .
#Text=Before you decide on a dog , do a bit of research to find the kind of dog that will be best for you .
#Text=Some breeds are easier to care for than others , and some dogs will need special care for disabilities or illnesses .
#Text=If you have the time and money for it , always try to get a dog like this .
#Text=They are difficult to find homes for and are usually put down by shelters .
#Text=Make sure you have everything your dog will need , such as a dog bed , dog bowls for food and water , good quality dog food , and a leash and collar before adopting or purchasing your dog .
#Text=Caring For Your Dog
#Text=Spend time with them .
#Text=Dogs are very social animals , so you need to pay lots of attention to them to make them feel happy and loved .
#Text=Pet them and play with them every day .
#Text=Getting another dog is usually a good idea to prevent them from getting lonely , if you have the space and money for it and you have enough room .
#Text=Provide somewhere suitable to sleep .
#Text=When your dog is a puppy , they will need to go to bed early .
#Text=Make sure you have a comfy bed for them to sleep in and that they go to bed as often as they need to .
#Text=On average , dogs need about 12-14 hours of sleep , but may need more or less depending on their breed , size and age .
#Text=Be sure to feed your dog at least three times a day .
#Text=Provide fresh water at all times .
#Text=Feed your dog the right kind of food to have a healthy diet .
#Text=If your dog is n't eating , you might want to try changing the brand of food that you 're giving them ; however , they may be sick , and will need to see a vet if they still wo n't eat .
#Text=Make sure you have time to walk your dog at least once a day so that they can get exercise .
#Text=If dogs are n't walked enough , they may develop heart problems , become overweight , or develop destructive tendencies .
#Text=Remember not to overwork your dog : they need to build stamina the same way humans do , so you want to take it easy on them at first , especially if they 're already overweight .
#Text=Groom and wash your dog .
#Text=Make sure you buy a quality brush that fits the needs of your dog 's coat .

#Text=You should also be sure to wash your dog when ever they get too dirty , but not too often , as your dog 's skin may become too irritated ; bathing your dog every week or every other week is too often .
#Text=If they do n't like bathing , be sure to reward them afterwards .

#Text=If you 're having trouble grooming your dog by yourself , or they have a difficult coat to look after , take them to a groomer every six to eight weeks , depending on how fast their hair and nails grow .
#Text=Train carefully and consistently .
#Text=When training your dog , make sure it 's in a big place such as a park or a big backyard .
#Text=Always reward your dog , with a treat or a pet , when it has done something well during training .
#Text=This will reinforce that they are doing a good thing , and will make them listen to your commands more often
#Text=Provide substitute care when you 're gone .
#Text=If you are away on vacation , make sure to leave your dog with a pet-sitter or at a kennel so that they are taken care of , even without you there .
#Text=Foods to Provide and Avoid Giving Your Dog
#Text=Doc : Foods Dogs Can Eat , Foods to Avoid Feeding Your Dog
#Text=Tips
#Text=Love them .
#Text=Your dog will love and respect you if you play and feed him/her .
#Text=Be prepared .
#Text=If you get a puppy , it is likely to whine and cry a lot .
#Text=You will need some newspaper or a puppy pad to house train your dog .
#Text=A good strategy for this is to keep moving the newspaper closer and closer to the door and so that eventually your dog will learn to pee outdoors .
#Text=It 's a good idea to keep your dog 's bed close to the door , or at least downstairs so that if they need to go outside quickly to pee , they will be able to .
#Text=You should also invest in a dog door .
#Text=Do not leave a new puppy alone for more than an hour .
#Text=If you can , check on them periodically if you 're nearby .
#Text=Train your dog to use a chew toy so that they wo n't chew your furniture .
#Text=Buy toys that they wo n't eat or destroy too quickly .
#Text=Sometimes your dog will bond with a cat , but not always .
#Text=Make sure to introduce them slowly , and make sure they like each other before leaving them in the same room together .
#Text=If they do n't trust or like each other , they might hurt each other .
#Text=Do n't worry if your dog does not immediately trust you ; it will take a while for him/her to warm to you .
#Text=Do n't force him/her to immediately be your best friend - this plan normally backfires and creates problems in your relationship .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do not neglect or harm your dog in any way .
#Text=It 's illegal , and just a bad thing to do .
#Text=Quick Summary
